org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel.processor.activity

Class DisabledActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.taverna.annotation.AbstractAnnotatedThing<Activity<?>>
      • org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel.processor.activity.AbstractActivity<ConfigType>
        • org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel.processor.activity.AbstractAsynchronousActivity<T>
          • org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel.processor.activity.NonExecutableActivity<ActivityAndBeanWrapper>
            • org.apache.taverna.workflowmodel.processor.activity.DisabledActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Annotated<Activity<?>>, Configurable<ActivityAndBeanWrapper>, Activity<ActivityAndBeanWrapper>, AsynchronousActivity<ActivityAndBeanWrapper>, WorkflowItem

    public final class DisabledActivity
extends NonExecutableActivity<ActivityAndBeanWrapper>
    A disabled activity is a wrapper for an Activity that is offline or similarly disabled. This cannot be done just by setting a flag on the corresponding activity as special code needs to be used to create the ports of the disabled activity that, obviously, cannot be done by confighuring the offline activity.
    Author:
    alanrw

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisabledActivity

        public DisabledActivity(Class<? extends Activity<?>> activityClass,
                        Object config)
                 throws InstantiationException,
                        IllegalAccessException,
                        ActivityConfigurationException
        Create a DisabledActivity that represents an offline activity of the specified class with the specified configuration. This constructor is commonly used when reading in an Activity which cannot be initially configured because it is offline.
        Parameters:
        activityClass - The class of Activity that is offline.
        config - The configuration of the offline Activity.
        Throws:
        InstantiationException
        IllegalAccessException
        ActivityConfigurationException

      • DisabledActivity

        public DisabledActivity(Activity<?> activity,
                        Object config)
        Create a DisabledActivity that represents a specific Activity with its configuration.
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity that is offline
        config - The configuration of the activity.

      • DisabledActivity

        public DisabledActivity(Activity<?> activity)
        Create a DisabledActivity that represents a specific Activity that is now disabled e.g. by its remote endpoint going offline. Note that in this case, the ports of the DisabledActivity and their mapping to the containing Processor's ports can be inherited from the Activity that is now disabled.
        Parameters:
        activity - The Activity that is now disabled.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        public void configure(ActivityAndBeanWrapper conf)
               throws ActivityConfigurationException
        Description copied from class: AbstractAsynchronousActivity
        Called immediately after object construction by the deserialisation framework with a configuration bean built from the auto-generated XML.

        This method is responsible for the creation of input and output ports, something that is currently done in the constructor of the Taverna 1 Processor class.

        Specified by:
        configure in interface Configurable<ActivityAndBeanWrapper>
        Specified by:
        configure in interface Activity<ActivityAndBeanWrapper>
        Specified by:
        configure in class AbstractAsynchronousActivity<ActivityAndBeanWrapper>
        Throws:
        ActivityConfigurationException
        See Also:
        Activity.configure(java.lang.Object)

      • getConfiguration

        public ActivityAndBeanWrapper getConfiguration()
        Description copied from class: AbstractAsynchronousActivity
        Get a configuration bean representing the definition of the activity. This bean should contain enough information to rebuild the input and output port sets, mappings are explicitly handled by the serialisation framework but the ports are assumed to be generated during the configuration stage rather than explicitly stored.
        Specified by:
        getConfiguration in interface Configurable<ActivityAndBeanWrapper>
        Specified by:
        getConfiguration in class AbstractAsynchronousActivity<ActivityAndBeanWrapper>
        See Also:
        Configurable.getConfiguration()
